sen.j: 大野寺（おおのでら）は奈良県宇陀市室生村にある真言宗室生寺派の寺院である。
sen.e: Oono-dera is Shingon sect Murou-ji-ha temple in Muro-mura, Uda City, Nara Prefecture.
Ono-dera Temple is a temple of the Murou-ji school of the Shingon sect in Muro-mura, Uda City, Nara Prefecture.
sen.cmt: ローマ字表記ミスがあります。文法修正し、単語を統一用語に変更しました。
sen.e: Ono-dera Temple is a temple of the Murou-ji school of the Shingon sect in Muro-mura, Uda City, Nara Prefecture.

sen.j: 山号は楊柳山、本尊は弥勒菩薩、開山は役小角（えんのおづぬ）と伝える。
sen.e: Sango (title given to Buddhist temple) is Yoryu-zan, honzon (principle image of Buddha) is Miroko Bosatsu (Buddha of the Future, Bodhisattva of the Present), and the founder is EN no Ozunu.

Its sango (literally, "mountain name"), which is the title prefixed to the name of a Buddhist temple, is Yoryu-san, the honzon (the principle image of Buddha) is Miroku Bosatsu (Maitreya Bodhisattva), and the founder is said to be EN no Ozunu.
sen.cmt: 「楊柳山」は「Yoryu-san」と読むのだと思われます。統一用語を使用、スペルミスを直しました。「弥勒菩薩」は用語集上の(Maitreya Bodhisattva)としました。
sen.e: Its sango (literally, "mountain name"), which is the title prefixed to the name of a Buddhist temple, is Yoryu-san, the honzon (the principle image of Buddha) is Miroku Bosatsu (Maitreya Bodhisattva), and the founder is said to be EN no Ozunu.

sen.j: 室生寺の西の大門に位置する。
sen.e: It is located at the Great West Gate of Muro-ji Temple.
It is located at the Great West Gate of Muro-ji Temple.
It is located at the Great West Gate of Muro-ji Temple.

sen.j: 宇陀川岸の自然岩に刻まれた弥勒磨崖仏があることで知られ、枝垂桜の名所としても知られる。
sen.e: It is known to have Miroku magaibutsu which is engraved on the natural rock on the riverbank of Uda-gawa River, and is also famous for their weeping cherry tree.

It is known to have Miroku Magaibutsu (images of Buddha carved on a cliff or natural rock face) carved on the natural rock on the riverbank of Uda-gawa River, and is also famous for beautiful weeping cherry trees.
sen.cmt: 「磨崖仏」の説明(images of Buddha carved on a cliff or natural rock face)を補足しました。
sen.e: It is known to have Miroku Magaibutsu (images of Buddha carved on a cliff or natural rock face) carved on the natural rock on the riverbank of Uda-gawa River, and is also famous for beautiful weeping cherry trees.

sen.j: 役行者霊蹟札所。
sen.e: En no Gyoja Reiseki Fudasho (Sacred Site for pilgrimage)
It is one of En no Gyoja Reiseki Fudasho (sacred sites for pilgrimages associated with EN no Ozunu).
sen.cmt: It isを補い一文とし、一部説明も補足しました。
sen.e: It is one of En no Gyoja Reiseki Fudasho (sacred sites for pilgrimages associated with EN no Ozunu).

sen.j: 宇陀川沿いの景勝の地にあり、近鉄室生口大野駅方面から室生寺へ向かう際の入口に位置する。
sen.e: Oono-dera Temple is at the place of scenic beauty, along the Uda-gawa River, and at the entrance way to Muro-ji Temple from Kintetsu Muroguchi Oono Station direction.
Ono-dera Temple is located at the place of scenic beauty along Uda-gawa River and at the entrance of the way from Muroguchi Ono Station on Kintetsu Line to Muro-ji Temple.
sen.cmt: ローマ字表記ミスを修正し、表現も分かりやすいよう変更しました。
sen.e: Ono-dera Temple is located at the place of scenic beauty along Uda-gawa River and at the entrance of the way from Muroguchi Ono Station on Kintetsu Line to Muro-ji Temple.

sen.j: 伝承では白鳳9年（681年）、役小角（役行者）によって草創され、天長元年（824年）に空海（弘法大師）が堂を建立して「慈尊院弥勒寺」と称したという。
sen.e: The tradition tells that it was founded by EN no Ozunu (EN no Gyoja) in 681, and Kukai (Kobo Daishi) erected the main hall and called it 'Jisonin Miroku-ji Temple.'
Tradition says that it was founded by EN no Ozunu (EN no Gyoja) in 681 and that Kukai (Kobo Daishi) erected the main hall in 824 and named it 'Jisonin Miroku-ji Temple.'
sen.cmt: Tellはここでは文法的に不可だと思います。訳漏れあり「824年」、補足しました。
sen.e: Tradition says that it was founded by EN no Ozunu (EN no Gyoja) in 681 and that Kukai (Kobo Daishi) erected the main hall in 824 and named it 'Jisonin Miroku-ji Temple.'

sen.j: 役小角は修験道の開祖とされる伝説的要素の多い人物であり、空海が堂を建立との話も創建を宗祖に仮託した伝承と思われ、創建の正確な経緯は不明というべきであろう。
sen.e: EN no Ozunu was a type of person with many legends who was thought to be the founder of Shugendo (Japanese ascetic and shamanistic practice in mountainous sites), and the story about Kukai erecting the hall is thought to be the pretext tradition, and the actual history behind the foundation of this temple remains unknown.

However, EN no Ozunu was a semi-legendary person who is thought to be the founder of Shugendo (Japanese ascetic and shamanistic practice in mountainous sites), and that Kukai erected the hall is also thought to be a legendary story created in order to pretext that Kukai, the sect founder, founded the building, so it should be said that what really happened with regard to the foundation of this temple is, in fact, unknown.
sen.cmt: 訳漏れ。「創建を宗祖に仮託した」の部が訳されていないので、補いました。「伝説的要素の強い」はsemi-legendaryとしました。文中の「宗祖」は空海であるとして訳しました。
sen.e: However, EN no Ozunu was a semi-legendary person who is thought to be the founder of Shugendo (Japanese ascetic and shamanistic practice in mountainous sites), and the story that Kukai erected the hall is also thought to be a legendary story created in order to establish that Kukai, the sect founder, founded the building, so it should be said that what really happened with regard to the foundation of this temple is, in fact, unknown.

sen.j: 近くにある室生寺は興福寺系の僧によって創建・整備されており、大野寺の磨崖仏造立にも興福寺の僧が関係していることから見て、興福寺と関係の深い寺院であったと思われる。
sen.e: Muro-ji Temple which is near, was founded and maintenance was conducted by the monks of Kofuku-ji Temple, and from where the monks of Kofuku-ji Temple was involved in the completion of Miroku Bosatsu carving in the rock of Oono-dera Temple, it can be said that this temple had close relations with Kofuku-ji.

Muro-ji Temple, located in its neighborhood, was founded and has been maintained by priests connected with Kofuku-ji Temple and the foundation of Miroku magaibutsu in Ono-dera Temple also involved the priests of Kofuku-ji Temple; these facts suggest that it had close relations with Kofuku-ji Temple.
sen.cmt: 文法ミスを複数修正し、表現にも若干修正を加えました。
sen.e: Muro-ji Temple, located in its neighborhood, was founded and has been maintained by priests connected with Kofuku-ji Temple and the foundation of Miroku magaibutsu in Ono-dera Temple also involved the priests of Kofuku-ji Temple; these facts suggest that it had close relations with Kofuku-ji Temple.

sen.j: 宇陀川をはさんだ対岸にある弥勒磨崖仏は、「石仏縁起」（万治2年・1659年）や「興福寺別当次第」によれば、興福寺の僧・雅縁の発願により、承元元年（1207年）から制作が開始され、同3年に後鳥羽天皇臨席のもと開眼供養が行われたものである。
sen.e: From 'Sekibutsu engi' (The history of stone Buddha statue) (1659) and 'Kofukuji Betto Shidai', it is said that Miroku magaibutsu which is at the riverbank of Uda-gawa River, the construction started in 1207 due to the order of the monk Gaen of Kofuku-ji Temple, and about 3 years later, a ceremony to consecrate a newly made Buddhist image was held with the presence of Emperor Gotoba.

According to 'Sekibutsu Engi (the history of stone Buddha statues)' (1659) and 'Kofuku-ji Betto Shidai', the construction of Miroku Magaibutsu, which stands at the opposite riverbank across Uda-gawa River, started in 1207 under the direction of Gaen, a priest of Kofuku-ji Temple, and in 1208 kaigen-kuyo (a ceremony to consecrate a newly made Buddhist image) was held in the presence of Emperor Gotoba.
sen.cmt: 文法ミスと、誤訳（同3年に後鳥羽天皇～）部分を修正しました。「同3年」は万治3年＝1208年をさすものとして訳しました。
sen.e: According to 'Sekibutsu Engi (the history of stone Buddha statues)' (1659) and 'Kofuku-ji Betto Shidai', the construction of Miroku Magaibutsu, which stands at the opposite riverbank across Uda-gawa River, started in 1207 under the direction of Gaen, a priest of Kofuku-ji Temple, and in 1208 kaigen-kuyo (a ceremony to consecrate a newly made Buddhist image) was held in the presence of Emperor Gotoba.

sen.j: 寺は明治33年（1900年）の火災で全焼した。
sen.e: In 1900, the temple was completely burned down.
In 1900, the temple was completely burned down in a fire.
In 1900, the temple was completely burned down in a fire.

sen.j: その際、本尊をはじめとする仏像などは持ち出されたが、現存する建物はすべて火災以後のものである。
sen.e: During the fire, honzon and statue of Buddha was rescued, but all the buildings had to be constructed again after the fire.
On the occasion the honzon and other statues of Buddha were rescued and still remain, while all the buildings that exist now were constructed again after the fire.
sen.cmt: 文法ミスがあり（S/V agreement）、文の後半は原文との意味の違いが大きいので書き直しました。
sen.e: On the occasion the honzon and other statues of Buddha were rescued and still remain, while all the buildings that exist now were constructed again after the fire.

sen.j: 本堂－本尊木造弥勒菩薩立像（秘仏）を安置する。
sen.e: Hondo (main temple) - Honzon wooden standing statue of Miroku Bosatsu is enshrined.
Hondo (main temple) — the wooden standing statue of Miroku Bosatsu of the honzon (the principal image) (a Buddhist image normally withheld from public view) is enshrined here.
sen.cmt: 訳漏れ。秘仏が訳されていないので補いました。
sen.e: Hondo (main temple) — the wooden standing statue of Miroku Bosatsu of the honzon (the principal image) (a Buddhist image normally withheld from public view) is enshrined here.

sen.j: 地蔵堂
sen.e: Jizo-do Hall
Jizo-do Hall

sen.j: 木造地蔵菩薩立像（重要文化財）－鎌倉時代の寄木造の像で、無実の娘を火あぶりの刑から救ったという伝説にちなみ「身代わり地蔵」と呼ばれている。
sen.e: Wooden standing statue of Jizo Bosatsu (Important cultural property) - Statue made with yosegi-zukuri (a method of constructing a statue by assembling pieces of wood) from Kamakura period, and it is called 'Scapegoat Jizo' due to the legend that it saved an innocent girl from execution by burning.

Wooden standing statue of Jizo Bosatsu (an important cultural property) — a statue made with yosegi-zukuri (a method of constructing a statue by assembling pieces of wood) in the Kamakura period, called 'Scapegoat Jizo' due to the legend that it saved an innocent girl from being burnt at the stake.
sen.cmt: 文法、表現を修正しました。
sen.e: Wooden standing statue of Jizo Bosatsu (an important cultural property) — a statue made with yosegi-zukuri (a method of constructing a statue by assembling pieces of wood) in the Kamakura period, called 'Scapegoat Jizo' due to the legend that it saved an innocent girl from being burnt at the stake.

sen.j: 弥勒磨崖仏（史跡）
sen.e: Miroku magaibutsu (historic site)
Miroku Magaibutsu (a historic site)

sen.j: 宇陀川の対岸に位置する高さ約30ｍの大岩壁に刻まれている。
sen.e: It is engraved on a large rock face 30m high above the riverbank at Uda-gawa River.
It is engraved on a large rock face 30m high above the riverbank at Uda-gawa River.
It is engraved on a large rock face 30m high above the riverbank at Uda-gawa River.

sen.j: 岩壁を高さ13.8ｍにわたって光背形に掘り窪め、その中を平滑に仕上げた上で、像高11.5メートルの弥勒仏立像を線刻で表す。
sen.e: Rock face is engraved in the shape of a halo in the height of 13.8m, inside is done flat and smooth, and 11.5m standing statue of Miroku-butsu expressed in line engraving.

The rock face was carved in the shape of a halo, which is 13.8m in height with the inner surface made flat and smooth, on which the 11.5-meter-tall standing statue of Miroku-butsu (Miroku Buddha) is depicted by engraving lines.
sen.cmt: 文法と表現を修正しました。
sen.e: The rock face was carved in the shape of a halo, which is 13.8m in height with the inner surface made flat and smooth, on which the 11.5-meter-tall standing statue of Miroku-butsu (Miroku Buddha) is depicted by engraving lines.

sen.j: 前述のように、興福寺の僧・雅縁の発願により、承元元年（1207年）から制作が開始され、同3年に後鳥羽上皇臨席のもと開眼供養が行われたものである。
sen.e: Like mentioned before, due to the order of the monk Gaen of Kofuku-ji Temple, the construction had begun and 3 years later a ceremony to consecrate a newly made Buddhist image was held with the presence of Emperor Gotoba.

As mentioned above, the construction began under the direction of Gaen, a priest of Kofuku-ji Temple, in 1207 and kaigen-kuyo (a ceremony to consecrate a newly made Buddhist image) was held in 1208 in the presence of Emperor Gotoba.
sen.cmt: 誤訳部を修正し、かつ表現も修正しました。
sen.e: As mentioned above, the construction began under the direction of Gaen, a priest of Kofuku-ji Temple, in 1207 and kaigen-kuyo (a ceremony to consecrate a newly made Buddhist image) was held in 1208 in the presence of Emperor Gotoba.

sen.j: 作者は宋から来日した石工・伊行末（いぎょうまつ/いのゆきすえ）の一派と考えられている。
sen.e: It is said to have been made by the group of stone mason, Igyomatsu who came to Japan from Sung.
It is said to have been made by a group of stone masons headed by Igyomatsu, or also called I no Yukisue, who was from Sung.
sen.cmt: 文法ミスを直し、説明を補足しました。いのゆきすえの読みも追加しました。
sen.e: It is said to have been made by a group of stone masons headed by Igyomatsu, or also called I no Yukisue, who was from Sung.

sen.j: 山城国笠置山 (京都府)にあった弥勒の大石仏（現在は光背のみが残る）を模したものである。
sen.e: It's modeled after the great stone Buddha of Miroku (currently only the halo is left) of Kasagi-yama Mountain, Yamashiro Province.
It was modeled after the Great Stone Buddhist Image of Miroku (of which currently only the halo is left), which was in Kasagi-yama, Yamashiro Province (Kyoto Prefecture).
sen.cmt: contractions(It's)は使うべきではないと思います。「弥勒の大石仏」は定訳不明のため、ここでは「the Great Stone Buddhist Image of Miroku」としました。
sen.e: It was modeled after the Great Stone Buddhist Image of Miroku (of which currently only the halo is left), which was in Kasagi-yama, Yamashiro Province (Kyoto Prefecture).

sen.j: 岩盤からの地下水の滲出等で剥落の危険があったため、1993年から1999年にかけて保存修理工事を実施。
sen.e: Since there was a danger of masonry falling due to seepage of groundwater from the rock, the maintenance construction took place from 1993 to 1999.
There was a possibility of the exfoliation caused by the seepage of groundwater from the rock and etc., so the construction for repair and maintenance was conducted from 1993 to 1999.
sen.cmt: 分かりやすくするため表現及び単語を変更しました。
sen.e: There was a possibility of the exfoliation caused by the seepage of groundwater from the rock and etc., so the construction for repair and maintenance was conducted from 1993 to 1999.

sen.j: 岩表面の苔類の除去や地下水の流路を変える工事などが行われた。
sen.e: The construction to remove the liverwort from the rock surface and to change the flow of groundwater was done.
